page.title: 03TRAVELLING TO WORK
page.content: Laughton is a small village in Sussex. Although there are not very many people living there, they work in lots of different places. We went round the school and asked the children where their parents worked: seventy children were in school that day. There were 14 parents who worked in Laughton, mainly in agriculture-related jobs. The next most popular place was Brighton, with 13 parents working there. London had 11 and Lewes, our county town, 7. Other workplaces included Glynde, where 5 parents work, Glyndebourne(3), Ripe(3), Burgess Hill(2), Peacehaven(2), and Chalvington(2). Other parents travel as far as Maidenhead, Birmingham and Manchester. People who work a long way away have to travel by car because Laughton has no train station and very few buses.
